PC Master race!

Can we get the official comments by the devs posted here and on reddit put in the main devnote so people dont have to hunt them all down?

Anyways, Im in the 'dont give a crap' camp. But there is a lot of crap on here from people.

1. Is this really a devnote? Not really but apparently they didnt have anything much else to say. Still working, read last weeks and it would probably be close. Though I will say that some actual comments from someone would have been nice, even if it was a link to the reddit articles or something.

2. Do we want a PS4 version? Mostly no it would seem but thats us. Others might. Harv wanted it on many platforms for a while but was limited. When one of those limitations was removed he went for it. (Coulda been why there was a rush to release.)

3. Will this harm the PC version? Nope. Devs said it wouldnt and it apparently helped with the move to U5 so its a gain for the PC crowd.

4. "But the PS4 version will be made by people we dont like." Who cares? Its the PS4 version. If they do good or bad it really doesnt matter to us so why fret?

5. SQUAD isnt a charity. They are a company who likes to make money. Suck it up. They had a chance to expand the kerbal license to another platform and get other people to do the work. If someone comes with an offer like "We like your product, can we sell it in our platform and get other people to do the work? We will give you a cut of the sales." Why wouldnt they accept it?

Just calm down people, sure, be annoyed that the devnotes were a single picture. No matter what it was Id be annoyed. But PC Kerbal isnt going to stop, PS4 wont effect you unless its something you want. In that case this is good news.
Please add to the discussion, simple conjectures do little to add the (heated) discussion.

![XkeaBlQ.gif](http://i.imgur.com/XkeaBlQ.gif)

I don't like where this is going. This is going to split the amazing community of KSP in 2.

*"Right now 1.0.3 and 1.1 are being made separately, essentially. 1.1 can be expected in weeks to months, 1.0.3 in days to weeks."*

Well, that cleared that up - NOT.

It's time for a rant..... If your a fan-boy beware.

Christ, I'm fed up with KSP and I'm not the only one: I know four other friends - two of whom introduced me to the game & two I introduced to it - who were hard-core KSP addicts (I've been at it since 18.5). But, as they started delving more into 1.02, one-by-one they all lost interest, fed up with the bugs (my spaceplanes just hit the KSC in orbit and gone kaboom!), dodgy physics (how can one strut produce more drag than 4 wings?!?!!) and the stupid part balancing issues (frying nukes, anyone?).

Now I've stopped playing, too, waiting (probably in vain) for 1.03 to fix the issues and make KSP worth playing again. 

Seriously, I think Squad has lost the plot: judging by some of the half-baked decisions they've made over the last year, they can't even manage the development of the PC version properly, so how the hell are they going to manage the PS4 port as well, especially as Flying Tiger are just a bunch of pound-shop developers, by the looks of it?

Moreover, as the game is built around mods, Squad can't fall back on them, in the ported,version, to plug over the gaps in KSPs functionality. 

In fact, mods aside, I can't think of a game LESS suited to a games console because of its sheer complexity; (this situation reminds me of what happened to IL2 when it got ported: the ported-version became a dumbed-down, thumb-aching borefest, while the PC version became so buggy, it got blasted by the reviewers, failed to sell, and the franchise died in the process). 

What is going on with this decision? Is this a joke? Are Squad so arrogant to think the existing player-base doesn't matter anymore? I've always felt these guy's were making it up as they went along and now it looks to me like, Squad are either in-over-their-heads and trying to sell-off the game before its development stalls completely through poor project-management - or their plan, all along, was to not to finish the game, but to bash-it-out and make a quick buck by selling the project off, half-done to one of the big-boyz to finish (or ruin).

Unfortunately for them, it's taken the FOUR YEARS to get it to that state and I don't see Squad making a bundle anytime soon: it'll cost them a-plenty to get "Flying-Tiger" to come up with something workable for the PS4 (which is a bit of a flop anyway) and even longer before all that investment turns into profit, so all this stuff about money being ploughed back into better development is wishful thinking, in my view.

**Epic fail!**

One needs to learn how to walk before trying to run. And KSP is not very stable on its feet. (Pun intended.) Win/Mac/Linux versions are nearly identical. Making those three side by side makes sense. But at least get those working without flaws before porting KSP to a completely different platform.

Sorry to say it but decisions like this start to make me loose faith in SQUAD.
Maybe, erm... SONY?
> > This is the entire devnotes??

> 
> Ohohohoho i won't be so sure.
> As much as the FAQ claims it has speeded up the process and we have be always at war with Eurasia, i find it pretty clear the real decision to force the U5 upgrade into 1.0.3 (which was original supose to be bug and memory leaks fixing) and the delays on it is because of this in the first place.

No. Unity 5 was ALWAYS on the cards - they've been talking about it since Unity started pre-announcing Unity 5. Players have been *demanding* it since Unity started pre-announcing it! Unity 5 was always expected to make KSP better - better performance, better UI, better graphics. Also, Unity 5 is expected to fix the 64-bit problems under Windows, which has been a bugbear for a long time, especially for those with mod-heavy games.

With all those advantages, there was no way Squad were going to waste that opportunity, regardless of whether another company helped them or not. This deal hasn't changed *whether* we would get the Unity 5 upgrade, all it has changed is how long we have to wait.

> 
> **Epic fail!**
> One needs to learn how to walk before trying to run. And KSP is not very stable on its feet. (Pun intended.) Win/Mac/Linux versions are nearly identical. Making those three side by side makes sense. But at least get those working without flaws before porting KSP to a completely different platform.
> 
> Sorry to say it but decisions like this start to make me loose faith in SQUAD.

Squad are not writing the PS port. Another company, Flying Tiger Entertainment, is doing that, leaving Squad free to work on bug-fixing and the changeover to Unity 5. (Also, FTE are providing a lot of assistance to Squad with the Unity 5 work, which is helping things move on a lot faster.)

This is only for the good. We get the Unity 5 upgrade sooner, which means better performance, better graphics and a working 64-bit build under Windows. And Squad gets extra sales which will help them develop updates to KSP 1.x AND fattens them up for the long, hard grind to KSP 2.x, whenever that comes and whatever that turns out to be.

Hey everyone, I understand that this news is looked at a bit critically in a community that mainly consists of PC players, but I think we (as a community) are losing ourselves a bit here. KSP is coming to PS4, and that in my honest opinion is great news: it means more people get to enjoy Kerbal Space Program and discover how to rocket science. There are many great things to come to KSP both in the near future and further down the line, and it's sad to see people speculate or even state for fact otherwise when they have absolutely nothing to base this on; the same goes for the alleged "dumbing down" of the game. As Max said, partnering up with another studio even provides certain advantages for the PC version, such as the quick port to Unity 5.

Generalisations such as "console plebs" and "PC master race" really have no place in a level headed discussion. Any group of people is extremely diverse and setting a whole group aside as inferior is just silly and quite honestly degrading. They will not be condoned from here on out.

And finally, please be more respectful towards Squad. Constructive criticism, questions and even some scepticism are all fine, but in the end you're a guest on our forums and we do expect you to behave as guests.
